questionText: My sister often goes to ...... church by ...... bus.
Mel's mother is in ...... hospital, so we went to visit her last night.
Do you know ...... man who is waiting for the bus over there?
My ...... car is four years old, and it still runs well.
We went by ...... train to the west of England.
I __________ to school every day.
She __________ to eat vegetables.
We __________ TV every night.
You __________ ice cream!
He __________ at a restaurant on weekends.
Some teachers ____________ much homework.
Taylor and Adam __________ good friends.
_______ your parents let you go to bed late?
How many books __________ you read in a year?
He is good at football but he _____ want to play now.
He is talking for hours but I _______ understand anything.
How often ______ you go to the cinema?
She ______ like playing tennis. So she _____ plays tennis.
One of my friend ________ reads newspaper.
How many students ________ English?
Peter never feels lonely. He has got _________ friends.
Mr Johnson lived with his three _______ in the countryside
My mother needs _____ milk to make a cake.
I’d like to buy _________
There are not _____ in that classroom.
A prize ___ every year.
Everybody ___ by the news.
If we __________ the window yesterday, it __________ so cold in here.
options: had closed / would not have been

questionText: If the lady __________ the boy, he _________ into the van.
options: have not stopped / could have ran
had not stopped / would have run
had not stopped / could have ran

questionText: If you ____________ down the volume of your stereo, the neighbours would not have complained.
My boss said that she ________ there at noon.
They asked me when _________.
The teacher told us that Columbus ________ America in 1492.
Liam told me that he _____ his best in the exam the _____ day.
The mother asked her son _______.
The more you practice, ___________ you will become.
___________ you study, ___________ you will understand the subject.
The ___________ you exercise, ___________ you will feel.
Ann, __________ for the safety of her child, ran to stop him playing with the electric socket.
The police are searching the area __________ the boy was last seen.
The findings of the report are highly ___ and deserve further investigation.
Which sentence is correct?
options: Never I have seen such a performance.
Never have I seen such a performance.
I have never seen such a performance never.
Never seen I such a performance.

questionText: What does “mitigate” mean in an academic context?
options: To reduce the severity of something

questionText: Choose the correct sentence:
options: If she studies more, she would have passed.
If she studied more, she will pass.
If she had studied more, she would be more confident now.
If she studies more, she passes.

questionText: The study failed to ___ a direct connection between stress and heart disease.
Which of these is a strong collocation?
Identify the correct sentence:
options: It is important that he goes to the meeting.
It is important that he go to the meeting.
It is important that he gone to the meeting.
It is important that he went to the meeting.

questionText: What is the best synonym for “plummet”?
The roads were icy; ___, several accidents occurred.
He was praised for his ___ approach to solving the problem.
What does the phrasal verb “follow through (on something)” mean?
options: To complete something that has been planned or promised

questionText: He’s studying to become ___ engineer at ___ university in the UK.
The teacher asked the student to ___ the essay in more depth.
Choose the best phrase to describe a chart trend:
Choose the sentence with correct word form:
options: The government introduced a new regulate system.
The government introduced a new regulatory system.
The government introduced a new regulation systematize.
The government introduce a regulation system.

questionText: The experiment will be conducted under ___ conditions.
Choose the correct sentence:
options: By the time we arrive, they will finish the presentation.
By the time we arrive, they will have finished the presentation.
By the time we arrived, they will finish the presentation.
By the time we arrive, they finish the presentation.

questionText: The proposal was well-written. ___, it lacked originality.
